text:
Jill Tracy Jacobs Biden (nee Jacobs, previously Stevenson; born June 3, 1951) is an American educator. Biden is the First Lady-designate of the United States. She is married to President-elect Joe Biden. When he became Vice President in 2009, she became the Second Lady of the United States.
Early life.
Jill Tracy Jacobs was born on June 5, 1951, in Hammonton, New Jersey. She spent most of her childhood in Willow Grove, Pennsylvania. She attended the University of Delaware.
Marriage and family.
She met Joe Biden in 1975. They married in 1977. In 1981, their daughter Ashley was born.
Personal life.
Biden has taught high school for thirteen years. She has founded several charities. As Second Lady, she continued to teach part time.

annotations.surface_form: Second Lady of the United States
